result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacari Ledell Hayes

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Jacari Ledell Hayes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Jacari Ledell Hayes.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (13 pages) commencing 08-01-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Jacari Ledell Hayes in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Jacari Ledell Hayes in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court hears arguments as to bail.  For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail.  Defense requested status conference date to allow more time to review discovery with defendant.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacari Ledell Hayes in court, appear by video with attorney Jade K Hall, appear by video.  Defendant Jacari Ledell Hayes in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person  for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Village of Brown Deer Officer D. Reed.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to John Franke. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacari Ledell Hayes not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving during pendency of case.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nicole R E; Quentin L G; Lorine O; Nannette R R.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Jacari Ledell Hayes in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Jacari Ledell Hayes in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jacari Ledell Hayes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
